main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects were reported in Jacksonville, Florida, in July 1950.
interesting points: A large group of courthouse employees and passersby observed a round, aluminum-colored object moving swiftly across the sky for several minutes before it disappeared., Witnesses described the object as emitting no fiery trail and making no sound, although a few reported a faint whirring noise., One observer claimed to have seen three glowing objects moving at high speed, stopping suddenly and wavering in the air., Estimates of the object's size ranged from 25 to 50 feet in diameter., Local news articles reported on the strange sightings and speculated about the nature of the objects, but military services denied having any knowledge of them.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects resembling flying saucers
witness description: courthouse employees and passersby in the area
